HelpXML.Title: HYPk
HelpXML.Purpose: HYPk computes breakdown point and efficiency for hyp. tan. estimator

Item.Name: k
Item.ShortDesc: supremum of the change of variance curve
Item.LongDesc: $supCVC(psi,x) x \in R$. Default value is k=4.5

Item.Name: p
Item.LongDesc: Number of variables of the dataset (for regression p=1) UP TO NOW p=1 (JUST REGRESSION) TO DO FOR MULTIVARIATE ANALYSIS

Item.Name: c
Item.LongDesc: Scalar greater than 0 which controls the robustness/efficiency of the estimator Default value is c=4

Item.Name: shapeeff
Item.LongDesc: If 1, the efficiency is referred to the shape else (default) is referred to the location. TODO:Hac:shapeeff

Item.Name: bdp
Item.LongDesc: Breakdown point associated to the supplied value of c

Item.Name: eff
Item.LongDesc: Efficiency associated to the supplied value of c

Item.Name: A
Item.TypeInd: parameter A of hyperbolic tangent estimator.
Item.LongDesc: For more details see the methodological details inside "More About" below

Item.Name: B
Item.TypeInd: parameter B of hyperbolic tangent estimator.
Item.LongDesc: For more details see the methodological details inside "More About" below

Item.Name: d
Item.TypeInd: parameter d of hyperbolic tangent estimator.
Item.LongDesc: For more details see the methodological details inside "More About" below

HelpXML.MoreAbout: \[ HYPpsi(u) = \left\{ \begin{array}{cc} u & |u| \leq d \\ \sqrt{A (k - 1)} \tanh \left( \sqrt{(k - 1) B^2/A} (c -|u|)/2 \right) sign(u) & d \leq |u| < c, \\ 0 & |u| \geq c. \end{array} \right. \] It is necessary to have $0 < A < B < 2 normcdf(c)-1- 2 c \times normpdf(c) <1$

References.Item: Hampel,F.R., Rousseeuw P.J. and Ronchetti E.(1981), The Change-of-Variance Curve and Optimal Redescending M-Estimators, Journal of the American Statistical Association , Vol. 76, No. 375, pp. 643-648 (HRR)

Item.Title: HYPk with all default options.
Item.MATLABcode: [bdp,eff,A,B,d]=HYPk(4.5,1); disp('Constants A, B and d') disp(A) disp(B) disp(d)

Item.Title: Example of use optional argument c.
Item.MATLABcode: [bdp,eff,A,B,d]=HYPk(4.5,1,'c',3); disp('Constants A, B and d') disp(A) disp(B) disp(d)

Item.Title: Breakwodn point and efficiency.
Item.Desc: Analysis of breakdown point and asymptotic efficiency at the normal distribution as a function of k (supCVC) in regression.
